intro: Cardamine × smejkalii, commonly known as the hybrid buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is a natural hybrid between Cardamine pratensis and Cardamine bulbifera, exhibiting characteristics of both parent species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are trifoliate or palmately divided, and it produces small, yellowish flowers in early spring. The plant is often found in temperate regions of Europe and has limited distribution due to its specific ecological requirements.
